story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the lush, green foothills of the Himalayas, there lived a kind-hearted and hardworking father named Rajan. He had a beautiful little girl named Priya, who he loved more than anything in the world.

Priya was a curious and adventurous child, always eager to learn about the world around her. She would often ask her father questions about the stars in the sky, the animals in the forest, and the mysterious legends of the ancient Himalayas.

One night, as Priya lay in bed, listening to the soothing sounds of the forest, she asked her father, "Baba, why do the stars twinkle in the sky?"

Rajan smiled at his daughter's curiosity and replied, "Long ago, there was a wise old man named Siddhanta, who lived in these very hills. He had a magical telescope that allowed him to see beyond the stars, into the secrets of the universe.

One day, while looking through his telescope, Siddhanta saw a magnificent palace, made entirely of diamonds and gold, floating in the sky. The palace was home to the Star King and his beautiful Queen, who shone brightly in the night sky, twinkling like the stars they were.

The Star King and Queen were known for their generosity and kindness, and they ruled over the stars with love and wisdom. However, they were deeply saddened by the fact that they could never interact with the people of the earth, who gazed up at them in awe every night.

Siddhanta, who was a kind and compassionate man, felt pity for the Star King and Queen. He wished there was a way for them to come down from the sky and meet the people they so admired.

The wise old man consulted with the gods, who told him that the only way for the Star King and Queen to come down from the sky was to make a sacrifice. Siddhanta decided to give up his own life so that the Star King and Queen could walk among the people of the earth.

The gods, moved by Siddhanta's selflessness, granted his wish. The Star King and Queen were able to come down from the sky and spent many years on earth, teaching people about the wonders of the universe and showing them the beauty of the stars.

And that is why, my dear Priya, the stars twinkle in the sky. They are the souls of the Star King and Queen, who sacrificed everything for the people they loved."

Priya closed her eyes, her heart filled with wonder and awe. She fell asleep, dreaming of the magical palace in the sky and the wise old man who had made it possible for the Star King and Queen to come down to earth.

And from that day on, every time Priya looked up at the stars, she was reminded of her father's love and the sacrifices he would make for her.

The end.
